items.title: Sick of Publishing Node Package Headaches? Meet "build-a-npm" ğŸ“¦âœ¨
items.content_html:
Hey everyone! ğŸ‘‹ If youâ€™ve ever tried to create a new Node.js package from scratch, you know it can be a bit of a maze. You start with a blank folder, and suddenly youâ€™re lost in a sea of package.json configurations, TypeScript setups, ESLint rules, and figuring out how to get a CI/CD pipeline running. Itâ€™s enough to make you just want to go back to writing a single script. ğŸ˜«

I felt that same frustration, which is why Iâ€™m so excited to introduce build-a-npm, the brand new command-line tool I built to solve this exact problem. Think of it as your personal assistant for creating, managing, and publishing Node.js packages. It handles all the tedious boilerplate and complicated setups, so you can spend your time on what really matters: writing awesome code. ğŸ’»ğŸš€

What Does build-a-npm Do?

At its core, build-a-npm is all about making your life easier. Itâ€™s a CLI tool that automates the entire package development workflow. Instead of manually creating files and scripts, you just run one simple command, and it builds a modern, ready-to-go project for you.

Here are some of the things it takes care of:

  • âš¡ï¸ Instant Project Setup: Say goodbye to starting from a blank slate. build-a-npm generates a clean project structure with all the necessary files and folders, following modern best practices.
  • âœï¸ Built-in TypeScript Support: For all you TypeScript lovers out there, this tool has you covered. It includes a pre-configured tsconfig.json and a setup thatâ€™s ready for you to start typing.
  • ğŸ¤– CI/CD with GitHub Actions: No more guessing about how to set up continuous integration. The tool automatically creates a GitHub Actions workflow that runs your tests and prepares your package for publishing every time you push code.
  • ğŸš€ Seamless Publishing:build-a-npm integrates perfectly with both npmjs.com and GitHub Packages, allowing you to publish your package to both platforms with a single command. It even handles version bumping for you!
  • ğŸ“– Documentation Publishing: Want to create documentation for your package? The tool generates a script that can automatically publish your docs to GitHub Pages, so your users always have up-to-date information.

Getting Started is a Breeze

Ready to try it out? Itâ€™s as simple as installing it globally with npm:

Once installed, navigate to the folder where you want to create your new package and run the init command:

The tool will then walk you through a series of questions, asking you for your package name, version, and other details. In a few moments, your new package will be ready to go! Itâ€™s that simple.

Why I Built This

I built build-a-npm out of a personal need. I wanted a tool that would allow me to quickly scaffold new projects without getting bogged down in boilerplate. My goal was to create something that was not only powerful but also intuitive and fun to use. Itâ€™s an open-source tool, and Iâ€™m really excited to see what amazing things people build with it.

I hope youâ€™ll find it as helpful as I do. Give it a try on your next project, and let me know what you think! You can find the full documentation and source code on my personal git page here:

https://git.hsinghhira.me/build-a-npm/.

Happy coding! ğŸ‰

items.title: Hexo Advanced Image Optimizer Plugin
items.content_html:
The Hexo Advanced Image Optimizer Plugin enhances your Hexo site by leveraging the power of wsrv.nl, a high-performance image cache and resize service. Powered by Cloudflareâ€™s CDN, it delivers images from over 300 global datacenters, ensuring lightning-fast load times and optimal performance. With support for advanced image processing using technologies like nginx and libvips, this plugin transforms and optimizes images on-the-fly. Itâ€™s open-source, free to use, and seamlessly integrates with Hexo to process markdown images, cover images, CSS background images, and <object> tags.

Installation

Run the (any) following command in your Hexo project directory to install the plugin:

Usage

After installing the plugin, all image urls will be converted to CDN urls automatically. For example, the origin markdown file is

Then it will be converted to

The local image urls will be also converted. For example, the original file is

It will be rendered as

where https://example.com is the url of your blog that you set in _config.yml.

Configuration

The plugin can be configured globally in Hexoâ€™s _config.yml file under the cdn section or per post using front-matter in Markdown files. Front-matter settings override global settings for specific posts.

  1. Open your Hexo projectâ€™s _config.yml file.
  2. Add a cdn section to configure global settings (see Configuration below).
    Example:

Global Configuration (_config.yml)

Add a cdn section to _config.yml to set default options for all images. All options are optional, and defaults are applied when not specified.

Per-Post Configuration (Front-Matter)

Add a cdn section to a postâ€™s front-matter to override global settings for that postâ€™s images (e.g., cover image, markdown images, background images). For example:

ğŸ“€ Full Available Configuration Options

This page is getting way too longer so visit below link for full configration options.

Please Visit: https://git.hsinghhira.me/hexo-adv-img-optimizer/

Notes

  • Priority: Front-matter options (cdn: ...) in a post override global settings in _config.yml. If neither is set, defaults like the page-title-based filename (hello-example for â€œHello Exampleâ€) or null are used.
  • Aliases: Use either full names (e.g., brightness) or aliases (e.g., bri) in _config.yml or front-matter.
  • Validation: Ensure values match the expected format (e.g., crop as [10,20,100,100], brightness as a number between -100 and 100) to avoid errors.
  • SVG Exclusion: SVG images are excluded from CDN processing to preserve their vector format.
  • CDN Support: Verify that your CDN (e.g., images.weserv.nl) supports the specified options. Invalid values may be ignored.
  • Testing: After configuration, run hexo generate and inspect the generated HTML to confirm CDN URLs include the desired parameters (e.g., https://images.weserv.nl/?url=...&bri=20&filename=post-specific-image).

Troubleshooting

  • Images Not Processed: Ensure the plugin is installed correctly. Check for exclude_domains that might skip certain images.
  • Incorrect Filenames: Verify the filename setting in _config.yml or front-matter. If using the page-title default, ensure posts have a title in their front-matter.
  • CDN Errors: Confirm that the cdn_server supports the configured options (e.g., images.weserv.nl documentation: https://images.weserv.nl/).
  • WebP Not Working: Set use_webp: true and ensure the browser supports WebP. Check if output_format: webp is set correctly for specific images.

For additional help or feature requests, please open an issue on the pluginâ€™s repository or contact the maintainer.

Special Thanks

  • Jinzhe Zeng
  • hexo-util
  • html-tag

items.title: Website for Apple's iOS Shortcuts
items.content_html:
Visit: https://ios.hsinghhira.me/ ğŸ“±

Hey there, tech enthusiasts! ğŸ“± Today, I want to share with you another exciting story from my journey as a developer. This time, itâ€™s all about creating a static website using the powerful Google Custom Search script for searching Appleâ€™s iOS Shortcuts. So, buckle up and get ready to dive into the world of web development!

When I embarked on this project, my goal was clear: to create a website with a simple design that would provide an efficient way to search for Appleâ€™s iOS Shortcuts. I opted for a straightforward design without delving too much into complex CSS. The result? A website that wasnâ€™t bad looking, but perhaps not the most visually striking. ğŸ˜…

Creating this website turned out to be an incredibly easy project, thanks to the magic of Google Custom Search. All I had to do was add the iOS Shortcut directoriesâ€™ websites to the Google Custom Search dashboard, and voila! The script provided a seamless search experience for users on my webpage. It was a breeze! ğŸ’¨

If youâ€™re curious to explore the website I created, you can click on the link below. Go ahead and give it a try! Who knows, you might discover some amazing iOS Shortcuts that will make your Apple device even more powerful and efficient. ğŸš€

So, if youâ€™re in need of finding iOS Shortcuts or simply want to explore the world of Appleâ€™s shortcuts, feel free to check out the website. Happy searching, and may your Apple device become even more amazing with the power of iOS Shortcuts! ğŸ“±âœ¨

items.title: Muerte KOD - AIO PUBG Mobile Toolkit - Windows Software
items.content_html:
Download: https://github.com/HSinghHira/MuerteKOD/releases

Hey there, once again but this time for my fellow gamers! ğŸ® Today, I want to share with you a thrilling story about a unique project I undertook called Muerte KOD. Brace yourself for a tale of intrigue, innovation, and a touch of darkness!

But First, What on Earth is Muerte KOD? ğŸ˜¯â“

I know, I know, the name might raise a few eyebrows. So, let me clarify: Muerte, which means â€œdeathâ€ or â€œmurderâ€ in English, was a â€œlegalâ€ Windows software designed to enhance the gaming experience for the immensely popular game, PUBG Mobile. Now, before you call the authorities on me, let me assure you that the software itself didnâ€™t do anything wrong. It simply consisted of a collection of small tools aimed at helping players enjoy the game to the fullest. ğŸ˜…ğŸ”§

Creating Muerte KOD was both a challenge and an opportunity for me. It marked my first and, so far, my last venture into software development using Microsoft Visual Studio. I poured my heart and soul into this project, striving to provide as many useful features as possible for the gamers. ğŸ’ª

I dedicated countless hours to refining the software, ensuring that it not only delivered the desired functionality but also boasted an improved visual design. After all, a visually appealing interface can truly elevate the gaming experience. ğŸš€ğŸ¨

Muerte KOD, with its name meaning â€œdeathâ€ or â€œmurderâ€ in English, added an extra layer of intrigue to this exhilarating journey. Although the software aimed to enhance gameplay through various tools like MAC address spoofing, Defender Injector, Flush DNS, Advanced DNS Changer, HDD ID Changer, and more, itâ€™s important to note that it was all within the realm of legality. No rules were broken, I promise! ğŸ˜‰ğŸ”’

While Muerte KOD stands as my first and, for now, my last software endeavor using Microsoft Visual Studio, I cherish the experience and the knowledge gained along the way. It serves as a testament to the limitless possibilities that await us in the realm of game enhancement.

So, fellow gamers, keep exploring, keep innovating, and letâ€™s continue to push the boundaries of what we can achieve in the world! Game on! ğŸ®ğŸŒŸ

items.title: Pizza Dough Expiry Date Tagger - MS Excel VBA
items.content_html:
Download: https://github.com/HSinghHira/Dominos-Pizza-Dough-Tagger/releases

Hey there, folks! ğŸ• Today, I want to share with you an incredible story from my time working at Dominoâ€™s Pizza. It all started with a simple task: putting dough tags on newly made dough batches. It was a crucial health and safety requirement, and I hope they still follow it. But little did I know that this experience would lead me down a rabbit hole of Excel wonders. ğŸ©ğŸ’»

One day, during a not-so-busy shift, I couldnâ€™t help but notice that the dough tags we were using werenâ€™t exactly visually appealing. You know, they lacked that wow factor. ğŸ¤” So, when I got home, I decided to fire up Excel on my laptop to see if I could create better-looking tags. A quick Google search for inspiration, and voila! I had some good-looking tags ready to go. ğŸ·ï¸ğŸŒŸ

But then, it hit me. I would still have to manually enter all the details for each tag. ğŸ™‡â€â™€ï¸ Determined to find a solution, I hit the search button once again and stumbled upon the magnificent world of Macros and VBA (Visual Basic for Applications for full, I know fancy name ğŸ˜‘). ğŸš€

With newfound knowledge, I started with a simple file. It was nothing fancy, just a basic automation to ease the manual data entry process. Little did I know that this was just the beginning of an exciting journey. Every step of the way, I continued to develop and improve my Excel project. ğŸ“ˆ

In the end, I created something truly remarkable. If youâ€™re curious to see the different versions I released, head over to the GitHub repository. Unfortunately, I must confess that I no longer remember the password for the VBA, so you wonâ€™t be able to view the codes behind the magic. ğŸ§™â€â™‚ï¸ (maybe decrypt the file and tell me the password too ğŸ¤£)

This project is a true testament to the wonders of Excel and VBA. Despite not remembering much about VBA or even how to perform simple calculations in Excel, I somehow managed to create this masterpiece. Itâ€™s like a puzzle I solved without remembering how I did it. ğŸ§©ğŸ’¡

And guess what? If the need arises, I can create an even better Excel project than this one. Trust me, the possibilities are endless! ğŸ’ª

So there you have it, my extraordinary Excel adventure at Dominoâ€™s Pizza. Who would have thought that a simple task like dough tags would lead me down the path of Excel wizardry? ğŸŒŸâœ¨

Never underestimate the power of a curious mind and the vast capabilities of Microsoft Excel. Remember, with a little creativity and the right tools, you can build a whole new software-like system right within Excel itself. ğŸš€ğŸ’»

Stay curious, keep exploring, and who knows what other wonders await us in the world of spreadsheets! ğŸŒˆğŸ“Š

items.title: Meme Creator - PHP Based
items.content_html:
Okay this is kinda funnyâ€¦ but yep, I actually made another Dekh Bhai Meme Creator back in 2016 ğŸ˜‚

It was school days, Dekh Bhai memes were popping off in India, and apparently I couldnâ€™t get enough of them. So I built a second version â€” because why not?

I already talked about the first one in my older blog post (built with good olâ€™ JavaScript), but this time I decided to switch things up and write the whole thing in PHP ğŸ’»ğŸ˜

It was a fun little experiment and honestly, I learned a bunch about PHP along the way.

Thereâ€™s no live demo for this one (RIP hosting ğŸ˜…), but the codeâ€™s chilling on GitHub if youâ€™re curious! ğŸ› ï¸ğŸ“‚

But there are the Codes ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’»:

  • Full PHP Script: https://github.com/HSinghHira/Dekh-Bhai-Meme-Creator/

items.title: Meme Creator - JS Based
items.content_html:
Back in 2016, before I moved to New Zealand ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡¿, I decided to challenge myself with a lilâ€™ side project ğŸ’».

At the time, â€œDekh Bhaiâ€ memes were EVERYWHERE in India â€” if you know, you know ğŸ˜.

(Dekh Bhai = â€œLook, brotherâ€ for my non-desi friends ğŸ‘€ğŸ§”)

So I thought, why not try building something around it? I was just learning JavaScript and wanted to turn the memes into a fun web app.

Spoiler alert: it took me a whole month to build ğŸ˜… (yes, I was a total beginner).

The project was built entirely with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript â€” no fancy stacks, just good old basics ğŸ”§ğŸ§±

ğŸ‘‰ Check it out here: Git.hsinghhira.me/LookBro/

For styling, I used my comfort blanket â€” Bootstrap ğŸ§¶.

At that point, I had already used it in most of my mini projects, and it made responsive design way easier ğŸ“±ğŸ’»

I also threw in Normalize.css by Nicolas Gallagher to make sure the site didnâ€™t look like a mess on different browsers ğŸ§¹ğŸ–¥ï¸

For turning text into image (yup, like meme magic ğŸ§™â€â™‚ï¸âœ¨), I used Fabric.js â€” a super handy HTML5 canvas library with all kinds of cool interactive features.

It even supports SVG-to-canvas conversions, which made things feel extra pro ğŸ’¼

Changing text colors? That was powered by Prism.js by Lea Verou ğŸŒˆ

(Technically meant for syntax highlighting, but hey, we adapt ğŸ˜)

For the character selection box on the side, I used nanoScroller.js by James F.

Think Mac-style scrollbars, but for us mere mortals ğŸ–±ï¸ğŸ

Picking colors was made easy with JSColor.js by Jan Odvarko â€” a cute little color picker that just worked ğŸ¨ğŸ‘Œ

And lastly, I tried to make things social by using socialShare.js by Ritesh Kumar â€” sadly, itâ€™s now deprecated (RIP ğŸª¦), but it used to let you control social buttons like a boss.

Of course, holding all this together was good olâ€™ jQuery v2.1.0. A classic. Canâ€™t forget the OG ğŸ’¾ğŸ’™

Moral of the story? I started small, learned a ton, and had a blast building something people could actually use (and laugh at ğŸ˜„).

Still one of my fav beginner projects to date ğŸ’¯

items.title: AWS Cloud Practitioner Practice Quiz - JS Based
items.content_html:
Hey there, fellow learners! ğŸŒŸ Today, I want to share with you an awesome AWS Cloud Practitioner Practice Quiz that I created while I was learning AWS Cloud Engineering. ğŸš€ Itâ€™s not super fancy, but I made sure to keep it simple and easy to understand. Letâ€™s dive in and have some fun while testing our knowledge!

View Live Preview: https://quiz.hsinghhira.me/AWS-Cloud-Practitioner/

This quiz may not have all the bells and whistles, but it has all the essential features youâ€™d expect from any quiz website. ğŸ¯ Hereâ€™s what you can expect:

**1. Colorful Feedback: ** When you select a wrong answer, it will be highlighted in red, while the correct answer will be highlighted in green. ğŸŸ¥ğŸŸ© This way, youâ€™ll know exactly where you went wrong and where you excelled.

2. Customizable Questions: You can set the number of questions you want to tackle. ğŸ“ Behind the scenes, you can add as many questions as you want, giving you the flexibility to challenge yourself at your own pace.

**3. Randomized Questions: ** Each time you take the quiz, it will present you with random questions and options. ğŸ² This keeps things exciting and ensures that you never know what the next question will be. Itâ€™s like a surprise every time!

To make this quiz possible, I used the power of JavaScript. ğŸš€ By leveraging JavaScript, I was able to create a dynamic experience for you, right on a static webpage. How cool is that? ğŸ’»

For the visual styling, I employed the popular CSS framework called Bootstrap v5.1.0. ğŸ¨ This helped me quickly achieve a clean and professional look without spending too much time on the aesthetics. And of course, whatâ€™s a quiz without some icons? I used the awesome Font Awesome Icons to give the quiz a touch of visual appeal. ğŸŒŸ

I must admit, this quiz was a bit of a rush project. So, while I didnâ€™t spend a lot of time on its looks, I made sure it works perfectly and offers you plenty of options to enhance your learning experience. ğŸ“š

I hope you find this quiz both educational and enjoyable. Give it a try, challenge yourself, and letâ€™s see how well you know your AWS Cloud Practitioner knowledge! Remember, learning can be fun too! ğŸŒˆğŸ“šğŸ’¡
